title: The Ashgate Research Companion to Nineteenth-Century Spiritualism and the Occult
subject: Spiritualism -- History -- 19th century
Occultism -- History -- 19th century

Great Britain
description: "Critical attention to the Victorian supernatural has flourished over the last twenty-five years. Whether it is spiritualism or Theosophy, mesmerism or the occult, the dozens of book-length studies and hundreds of articles that have appeared recently reflect the avid scholarly discussion of Victorian mystical practices. Designed both for those new to the field and for experts, this volume is organized into sections covering the relationship between Victorian spiritualism and science, the occult and politics, and the culture of mystical practices. The Ashgate Research Companion to Nineteenth-Century Spiritualism and the Occult brings together some of the most prominent scholars working in the field to introduce current approaches to the study of nineteenth-century mysticism and to define new areas for research."--Provided by publisher
contents: Introduction; Part 1: Haunted Laboratories and Ghosts in the Machine: Spiritualism, Science and Technology: 1 Recent Scholarship on Spiritualism and Science; 2 The Sciences of Spiritualism in Victorian Britain: Possibilities and Problems; 3 The Undead Author: Spiritualism, Technology and Authorship; 5 The Cross-Correspondences, the Nature of Evidence and the Matter of Writing; Part 2: Occulture: Sex, Politics, Philosophy and Poetics -- Part 2: Occulture: Sex, Politics, Philosophy and Poetics: 6 The Evolution of Occult Spirituality in Victorian England and the Representative Case; 7 'Out of your clinging kisses ... I create a new world': Sexuality and Spirituality; 8 Socialism and Occultism at the Fin de Siècle: Elective Affinities; 9 William James: Belief in Ghosts; 10 The Turn of the Gyres: Alterity in 'The Gift of Harun Al-Rashid' and A Thousand and One Nights -- Part 3: Staging the Victorian Afterlife: From Magic Shows to Dinner Parties: 11 The Case of Florence Marryat: Custodian of the Spirit World/Popular Novelist; 12 'Gentleman Mountebanks' and Spiritualists: Legal, Stage and Media Contest Between Magicians; 13 Mirth as Medium: Spectacles of Laughter in the Victorian Séance Room; 14 'Eating, Feeding, and Flesh: Food in Victorian Spiritualism'; 15 'The Dear Old Sacred Terror': Spiritualism and the Supernatural from The Bostonians to; 16 'The Sublimation of Matter into Spirit': Anna Mary Howitt's Automatic Drawings; 17 Viewing History and Fantasy through Victorian Spirit Photography -- Bibliography -- Index.
